report_title: Online Camera and Camcorder Sales Industry Report
executive_summary: The Online Camera and Camcorder Sales industry has performed well over the five years to 2021. Over the past five years, per capita disposable income is expected to grow at an annualized rate of 3.0% and the percentage of households that own at least one computer rose to 94.5% in 2021, from 89.3% in 2016. Consequently, consumers have benefited from access to more of the resources needed to purchase discretionary goods online via e-commerce channels. A wider base of accessible consumers has also enabled new operators to enter the industry and benefit from the popularity of online sales, which has rapidly become more popular than traditional brick-and-mortar store retail.

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Altogether, the industry experienced growth over the five years to 2021 as positive macroeconomic factors gave consumers greater ability to purchase industry products. Simultaneously, the shifting retail landscape benefited companies that offer a strong online presence and platform, as online sales increased despite declining brick-and-mortar camera sales.

Industry revenue is expected to rise an annualized 4.3% over the past five years, reaching an estimated $5.8 billion in 2021. Although positive trends have ostensibly benefited the industry, revenue has been somewhat constrained by external competition in the form of smartphones and other multi-purpose devices that include cameras.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The industry is expected to continue experiencing revenue growth over the five years to 2026. E-commerce will continue to gain popularity as an alternative to brick-and-mortar sales, which will benefit industry operators. Similarly, consumer spending and confidence levels are forecast to increase, which will prompt greater recreation expenditure.

Apart from e-commerce, the proliferation of social media and digitalization of daily life has stimulated the popularity of several industry products, creating a new market of consumers. Online platforms such as YouTube and Instagram continue to stimulate demand from users.

industry_definition: This industry is composed of online retailers that sell video cameras, cameras, tapes, discs, video recorders and combination electronic game and disc players. Brick-and-mortar sales of these products are not included in the report.

negative_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level: low - steady

threats: Percentage of households with at least one computer

key_trends: Operators have had to hire highly skilled engineers
Smartphone manufacturers have upgraded camera technology
Marketing and advertising agencies that focus on social media have been a strong source of demand for cameras
General macroeconomic growth is expected to compound the continued shift toward online sales
Smartphones are expected to continue to represent a technological challenge for the industry
Competition within the industry will be based on reputation and reliability of operators and price
Smartphones' progressively higher-quality cameras threaten industry growth

market_segmentation.segment_description: Consumers aged 54 and older account for an estimated 37.9% of Online Camera and Camcorder Sales industry revenue. These consumers tend to be the least likely to rely on smartphones for their photo and video needs. Consequently, they are the most likely demographic to use industry products. Additionally, many of these consumers also have accumulated wealth that allows them to make discretionary purchases more freely than some younger consumers.

In 2021, consumers aged 45 to 54 years old represent an estimated 19.6% of industry revenue. Consumers in this segment typically have higher income levels, enabling them to spend more on discretionary purchases, such as high-quality cameras.
Consumers aged 35 to 44 represent the third-largest market for operators in the Online Camera and Camcorder Sales industry, at an estimated 18.5% in 2021.
Consumers aged 25 to 34 are expected to represent 15.1% of industry revenue.
This segment is expected to account for just 8.9% of industry revenue.

products_and_services.product_description: Cameras and other photographic equipment account for the majority (54.7%) of Online Camera and Camcorder Sales industry revenue.
Camcorders and video equipment have also experienced competition from new technologies in recent years.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Compact Discs, Records, Tapes and Other
products_and_services.product_description: Compact discs (CDs), records, tapes and all other video products are expected to account for 31.8% of industry revenue.

demand_determinants.determinant_description: One of the largest determinants of Online Camera and Camcorder Sales industry demand is technological change. Consumers typically desire to be adopters of cutting edge, new technology.
Another factor driving industry revenue is rising disposable income levels.
An emerging determinant of demand is the popularity of social media.

international_trade_points.trade_description: The Online Camera and Camcorder Sales industry only accounts for sales to US consumers.
The Online Camera and Camcorder Sales industry only accounts for sales to US consumers.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast region has the highest percentage of establishments at around 22.9%, but a relatively lower percentage of population.
The West region has the second highest percentage of establishments at around 19.5%, which is also higher than its population percentage.
The Mid-Atlantic region has a higher percentage of population compared to its percentage of establishments.
The Great Lakes region has a higher percentage of population compared to its percentage of establishments.
The Southwest region has a relatively lower percentage of both establishments and population.
The Rocky Mountains region has a relatively lower percentage of both establishments and population.
The Plains region has a relatively lower percentage of both establishments and population.
The New England region has a relatively lower percentage of both establishments and population.

regulations_points.regulation_title: Collecting Personal Information and Tracking Purchases
regulations_points.regulation_description: Depending on what type of information is being collected, there are different federal and state laws regarding privacy.

regulations_points.regulation_title: Streamlined Sales and Use Tax Agreement
regulations_points.regulation_description: Perhaps the most important regulation looming over the e-commerce sector is the Streamlined Sales and Use Tax Agreement.

barriers_points.barrier_description: The Online Camera and Camcorder Sales industry has low barriers to entry and initial capital investment is relatively low.
Industry operators do not require a license and there is no certification process for entry into the industry.

basis_points.basis_description: Price is typically the main point of competition in the industry.
Competition in the industry is based on factors including reputation.

concentration_points.concentration_description: The Online Camera and Camcorder Sales industry demonstrates a low level of market share concentration and is relatively fragmented.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: The nature of online shopping eliminates geographic boundaries.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The Online Camera and Camcorder Sales industry has a low level of capital intensity.

volatility_points.volatility_description: Overall, the Online Camera and Camcorder Sales industry has a moderately low level of revenue volatility.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Online Camera and Camcorder Sales industry operators have been the disruptor for traditional brick-and-mortar retailers in recent years.

FAQs.question: Does your company specialize in one corner of the market or do you retail a diversified range of products?
FAQs.answer: Smartphones with high-quality cameras are reducing demand for cameras.

FAQs.question: Are your company's sales heavily dependent on the health of the US economy?
FAQs.answer: Disposable income is increasing for consumers.
